title: Hierarchical Multi-label Classification for Fine-level Event Extraction from Aviation Accident Reports
abstract: arXiv:2403.17914v1 Announce Type: new  Abstract: A large volume of accident reports is recorded in the aviation domain, which greatly values improving aviation safety. To better use those reports, we need to understand the most important events or impact factors according to the accident reports. However, the increasing number of accident reports requires large efforts from domain experts to label those reports. In order to make the labeling process more efficient, many researchers have started developing algorithms to identify the underlying events from accident reports automatically. This article argues that we can identify the events more accurately by leveraging the event taxonomy. More specifically, we consider the problem a hierarchical classification task where we first identify the coarse-level information and then predict the fine-level information. We achieve this hierarchical classification process by incorporating a novel hierarchical attention module into BERT. To further

translated_title: 航空事故报告中细粒度事件提取的分层多标签分类
translated_abstract: 在航空领域记录了大量的事故报告，提高航空安全至关重要。为更好地利用这些报告，我们需要根据事故报告了解最重要的事件或影响因素。然而，不断增加的事故报告数量要求领域专家投入大量工作来标记这些报告。为了使标记过程更加高效，许多研究人员已开始开发算法，自动从事故报告中识别潜在的事件。本文认为，通过利用事件分类法，我们可以更准确地识别事件。具体来说，我们将这一问题视为一项分层分类任务，在此过程中首先识别粗粒度信息，然后预测细粒度信息。我们通过将一种新颖的分层注意力模块整合到BERT中实现了这种分层分类过程。
tldr: 本文提出将事件提取问题视为分层分类任务，利用分层注意力模块结合BERT，实现了先识别粗粒度信息再预测细粒度信息的自动事件识别方法。
en_tdlr: The paper proposes to treat event extraction as a hierarchical classification task, leveraging a hierarchical attention module combined with BERT to achieve automatic event recognition by first identifying coarse-level information and then predicting fine-level information.
